subject: Medicine
title: Allergies: Overreaction
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Allergies: Overreaction.

hook.text: Peanuts aren't toxic. But for some people, the immune system treats them like a deadly pathogen.

buildup.text: Allergies happen when the immune system overreacts to harmless substances like pollen, dust, or food.

discovery.text: IgE antibodies trigger mast cells to release histamineâ€”causing swelling, itching, and inflammation.

twist.text: Anaphylaxis is an allergy so extreme that blood pressure crashes and airways close within minutes.

climax.text: Allergies are increasing worldwide. The hygiene hypothesis suggests too-clean environments are to blame.

punchline.text: An allergy is your immune system solving a problem that doesn't exist.

quiz.question: What does the hygiene hypothesis suggest about allergies?
options: Too-clean environments lead to overreactive immune systems
Poor hygiene causes most allergic reactions
Allergies are entirely genetic with no environmental factors
